name: Llechwedd Glamping
what_makes_it_unique: Luxury safari tents perched on a hillside overlooking the historic Llechwedd Slate Caverns. Offers stunning views of the industrial landscape and direct access to zip lines and underground adventures.

name: Portmeirion Village
what_makes_it_unique: Stay within the iconic Italianate village designed by Clough Williams-Ellis. Choose from rooms in the hotel, self-catering cottages, or the castle itself, surrounded by sub-tropical gardens and colourful architecture.

name: Living Room Treehouses
what_makes_it_unique: Six enchanting treehouses hidden deep in a Welsh valley, completely off-grid and suspended high in the canopy. Features wood-burning stoves, solar lighting, and stunning valley views.

name: Forest Holidays Beddgelert
what_makes_it_unique: Luxurious log cabins nestled deep within Beddgelert Forest. Features include private hot tubs, log burners, and floor-to-ceiling windows for stargazing.

name: Graig Wen
what_makes_it_unique: Award-winning site with panoramic views of the Mawddach Estuary. Offers quirky accommodation including yurts, a shepherd's hut, and eco-cabins, all set within 45 acres of wild woodland.

name: Smugglers Cove Boatyard
what_makes_it_unique: Stay in a converted boat or a quirky boathouse right on the edge of the estuary. Features include wood burners and direct access to the water for kayaking.

name: The Laundry at Breathing Space
what_makes_it_unique: A beautifully converted historic laundry building with industrial chic design. Features exposed brickwork, high ceilings, and a wood-burning stove, located close to Snowdon.

name: Cae Wennol Yurts
what_makes_it_unique: Eco-friendly yurts set in a secluded wildflower meadow with stunning views of the Conwy Valley. Features include private compost toilets, solar showers, and a communal kitchen.

name: Snowdonia Shepherds Huts
what_makes_it_unique: Hand-crafted shepherd's huts situated in a peaceful meadow with breathtaking views of the Snowdonia mountains. Features include wood-burning stoves and outdoor fire pits.

name: Little Dragon Hut
what_makes_it_unique: A cosy and quirky shepherd's hut located just a short walk from the start of the Snowdon Llanberis path. Features a compact kitchen, double bed, and mountain views.

name: Caban Crwn
what_makes_it_unique: A unique, circular wooden cabin built using sustainable materials. Features a skylight for stargazing and a wood-burning stove, set in a tranquil woodland location.

name: The Eye Pod
what_makes_it_unique: A futuristic geodesic dome designed specifically for stargazing. Features a clear roof panel above the bed and is located in a Dark Sky Reserve area.

name: Ty Cwch
what_makes_it_unique: Innovative shipping container accommodation designed like a boat house, located directly on the beach. Features bunk-style sleeping pods and a communal living area.

name: Bryn Ifan
what_makes_it_unique: Eco-friendly yurts and a shepherd's hut overlooking the sea, with views towards the Llŷn Peninsula. Features include off-grid living and access to a private beach.

name: Riverside Camping Glamping Pods
what_makes_it_unique: Luxury glamping pods situated on the banks of the River Seiont. Features include underfloor heating, en-suite facilities, and private decking areas.
